isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Remove the 3rd-4th speed sliding clutch from the mainshaft front ( Figure 108).

figure.caption: Figure 108. Remove 3rd-4th Speed Sliding Clutch From Mainshaft Front

step1.para: Remove the reverse gear and spacer from the mainshaft rear ( Figure 109).

figure.caption: Figure 109. Remove Reverse Gear and Spacer From Mainshaft Rear

step1.para: From the mainshaft rear, pull the key from the mainshaft key way ( Figure 110).

figure.caption: Figure 110. Pull Key From Mainshaft Key Way

note.para: When removing limit washers, spacers and gears, note their location on the mainshaft to facilitate reassembly. Keep the internal-splined washers and external-splined spacers with the gear from which they were removed. There is ONLY one limit washer and one spacer belonging to each gear.

step1.para: Turn the reverse gear limit washer to align its splines with those of the mainshaft and remove washer ( Figure 111).

figure.caption: Figure 111. Turn Reverse Gear Limit Washer to Align Splines

step1.para: Remove the LO-Reverse speed sliding clutch from the mainshaft ( Figure 112).

figure.caption: Figure 112. Remove LO-Reverse Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Use a small screwdriver to turn the limit washer in the hub of the LO speed gear to align its splines with those of the mainshaft. Pull the LO speed gear from the rear of the mainshaft to remove the limit washer, spacer, and gear ( Figure 113). If necessary, remove the snap ring from the I.D. of the gear (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 113. Pull LO Speed Gear From Rear of Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove each remaining gear, limit washer, spacer, and sliding clutch from the mainshaft in the same manner as previously detailed ( Figure 114). If necessary, remove the snap ring from the I.D. of each gear.

figure.caption: Figure 114. Remove Each Remaining Gear, Limit Washer, Spacer, and Sliding Clutch
